pullRequest.body:
Our hoskinson runners have been going down periodically due to the .cache directory getting too large. This adds a step to the build which should keep it within a reasonable size.

cf. [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Error.3A.20No.20space.20left.20on.20device)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [84a481e7c2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22863/commits/84a481e7c2d409c3bc529939b69ee16d30830460)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I chose 10 GB since according to the thread, 60 GB is too large and my current local .cache size is around 1 GB, but of course this can be changed. Per Kim's suggestion we could also try to delete only old files but I decided to start with something simple.
Per Damiano's suggestion, the logs now show the current size of the cache (in bytes): https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13812024502/job/38635603338#step:3:24

Thanks: looks good to me!

I'll delegate, in case you want to try something else.

bors d+

:v: bryangingechen can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I think I'm happy with this as is, so let's just try it out in production for a while:
bors d+

:v: bryangingechen can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

```suggestion
          DIR_SIZE=$(du -sb "$CACHE_DIR" | cut -f1)
          printf '%s\n' "$DIR_SIZE"
```
to have some data available anyway.

What do you think?

Sounds good! (Claude originally had a snippet in its original suggestion to convert back to GB, but apparently `bc` isn't available on the runners, so I just went with your suggestion in the end instead.)
If you want human readable, maybe `du -h -d0` (untested) would work?  This could be used instead of the `printf` line, but I would still use bytes for the actual check.

pullRequest.title: ci: run lake exe cache clean if cache is larger than 10 GB
